J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>>I don't like it that every posting is read before it is published in 
>>this forum. This is not necessary. Imagine Sun doing this in their 
>>forum. They don't need that censorship nor does this forum need it. 
>>It has only disadvantages.
>>    
>>
>
>Assume that we did it for a reason. We did. Spam, spam, everywhere, spam.
>  
>
Sure, but you don't have to moderate every single post to remove spam.
On the NinJava mailing list we have all users posts moderated when they
first join, but once they send a non-spam post to the list we set that
individual user to unmoderated, and away they go. I have yet to see a
spam engine that can generate a single relevant post before it starts
spamming.

You should try it, it'll save you loads of work.

CHEERS> SAM
